intro: Tritomodon campanulatus, commonly known as the bell-shaped thistle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, bell-like inflorescence composed of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. Its leaves are usually spiny and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers range in color from white to purple. Tritomodon campanulatus is often found in open grasslands and along the edges of woodlands.
